page.title: 11SOCIAL LIFE IN OFFLEY
page.content: When asked what people did in their spare time, 50% of them said they enjoyed gardening, others spent time reading, sewing, walking, playing sport, visiting the theatre, listening to music and watching the television. As well as the sports clubs which we mentioned on page 2, there are five public houses in the village. Three of them have restaurants and many people come to the village to eat in them. A youth club is held weekly in the village hall and is run by a local parent. However there is little else to occupy the youngsters of the village. They go to neighbouring towns or villages to the Brownies, Guides, Cubs and Scouts. Dancing classes take place in Preston and Hitchin.
